name: Cult of Luna
description:
'''Cult of Luna''' is a Swedish [[post-metal]] band from [[Ume√•]] founded in 1998. Their style of music is similar to contemporary bands [[Neurosis (band)|Neurosis]] and [[Isis (band)|Isis]]. Cult of Luna was signed to [[Earache Records]] in the early 2000s and released five albums, including the commercially successful albums ''[[Salvation (Cult of Luna album)|Salvation]]'' (2004) and ''[[Somewhere Along the Highway]]'' (2006). After an extended period of inactivity, Cult of Luna returned with its Indie Recordings debut ''[[Vertikal]]'' (2013) and companion EP ''[[Vertikal II]]'' (2013), both drawing inspiration from [[Fritz Lang]]'s 1927 film, ''[[Metropolis (1927 film)|Metropolis]]''. In 2016 the band released their space-themed collaborative album, ''[[Mariner (album)|Mariner]]'', featuring American vocalist [[Julie Christmas]].
